page.title: 10PEEL CHURCH IN LITTLE HULTON
page.content: The{Kenyon family}(local gentry) provided the resources for the church to be built in 1876 to serve the needs of a small rural and mining community. Now, the{Reverend Bull}serves a parish containing over 22,000 people. After gaining a degree Rev.Bull did further training at theological college before becoming a vicar in 1977. The Sunday morning congregation of 170 people consists mainly of middle aged people, though the vicar is trying hard to attract more teenagers. Many people it seems want their children baptized{but do}not want the commitment of attending church regularly. People attending church service is greater now than the 1960/70's. The vicar believes more people are realizing that material existence is not everything and turn to the church to
